title: Textile, late 15th century
medium:
Medium: silk, metallic yarns
Technique: supplementary warp forming raised pile (velvet) in a 4&1 satin foundation, with discontinuous supplementary wefts (brocading)
provenance: ex. coll. Antonio Vivés y Escudero
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 116.8 x 22.9 cm (46 x 9 in.)
description: Large-scale pomegranate design within an ogival framework, in red velvet with two pile heights, gold brocading, and some gold in raised loops. May have been part of a chasuble.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, late 15th century.
late 15th century. Medium: silk, metallic yarns
Technique: supplementary warp forming raised pile (velvet) in a 4&1 satin foundation, with discontinuous supplementary wefts (brocading). Gift of John Pierpont Morgan. 1902-1-743.
